title: Maps and Frequency Counting
concept: This level introduces dictionary-like problems: synonym dictionaries, vote counting, word frequency, permissions. Implement in C using arrays of structs or parallel arrays.

challenges.title: Synonyms
challenges.description: You are given N pairs of synonyms (word1 word2). Then you are given one more word. Print its synonym from the pairs.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N, then N lines each containing two words. Then one more word.
challenges.outputDescription: The synonym of the given word.
examples:
Input:
3
big large
smart clever
fast quick
clever

Output:
smart

challenges.title: Election Votes
challenges.description: You are given records of candidates and vote counts for each state. For each candidate, sum total votes and print results sorted by candidate name.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N (number of records), then N lines: candidateName votes.
challenges.outputDescription: For each candidate, one line: name totalVotes, sorted alphabetically by name.
examples:
Example: if input has two lines 'Alice 10' and 'Bob 5', output:
Alice 10
Bob 5

challenges.title: Most Frequent Word
challenges.description: Given n lines of text, find the word that occurs most often. If there are many, print the lexicographically smallest among them.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer n followed by n lines of text.
challenges.outputDescription: Single word: most frequent (with smallest lexicographic order if tie).
examples: Example: text 'hi hi what is hi' -> hi

challenges.title: File Access Rights
challenges.description: You are given N files with allowed operations (read R, write W, execute X). Then M queries of operations on files. For each query, print OK if allowed, otherwise Access denied.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N, then N lines: fileName and allowed ops (e.g., 'file1 R W'). Then integer M and M lines: operation fileName.
challenges.outputDescription: For each query, one line: OK or Access denied.
examples: Example only: depends on input mapping.

challenges.title: Cities and Countries
challenges.description: Given a list of countries and their cities, then given Q city names, print the country of each city.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N, then for each country: countryName, integer k, then k city names. Then integer Q and Q city names.
challenges.outputDescription: For each query city, print its country.
examples: Example: if India has city Delhi and query is Delhi -> India.

challenges.title: Word Frequencies Sorted
challenges.description: Given n lines of text, print all words sorted by descending frequency; words with same frequency should be sorted lexicographically ascending.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer n followed by n lines.
challenges.outputDescription: Each word on its own line, sorted by the rule.
examples: Example: 'hi hi what is is' -> hi, is, what (one per line).

challenges.title: English-Latin to Latin-English
challenges.description: You are given an English-Latin dictionary. For each Latin word, build a list of English words that have it as a translation. Print the resulting Latin-English dictionary sorted lexicographically by Latin word.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N, then N lines: 'english - latin1,latin2,...'.
challenges.outputDescription: For each Latin word: 'latin - english1,english2,...' sorted lexicographically.
examples: Example based on Snakify 'Latin-English dictionary' problem.

challenges.title: Country With Most Words
challenges.description: Given N lines of 'country word' pairs, find the country that appears most often. If tie, print lexicographically smallest country.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N followed by N lines: countryName word.
examples: Example only; similar logic to most frequent word but for countries.

challenges.title: Student Scores Map
challenges.description: Given N lines of 'name score', sum scores per student and print each student with total score, sorted by name.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N followed by N lines: name and integer score.
challenges.outputDescription: Lines in format 'name totalScore', sorted by name.
examples: Example: Ram 10, Kiran 5, Ram 7 -> Ram 17, Kiran 5.

challenges.title: Word Synonym Replacement
challenges.description: Given a dictionary of synonym pairs and then a sentence, replace each word in the sentence by its synonym if present, otherwise keep it unchanged.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N, then N lines of 'a b' synonyms, then one line sentence.
examples: Example: synonyms: 'big large'; sentence: 'big cat' -> 'large cat'.
